Attendance at the game requires that all fans entering the facility will have to get a Temp Check completed before entry. If there are Temps that are 100.4 or over you will be asked to leave.

Restrooms will be available thru Porta Potties in the parking lot and restrooms located at the entrance gate into the Stadium.

There will not be any fans, family, workers, etc. allowed other than Essential Personnel onto the field. This is mandated by the Christian County Board of Education. This is required Pre Game, During the Game, and Post Game. Anyone one not following this procedure will not be able to attend another Soccer game this year.

Christian County Public Schools Family Resource and Youth Services Centers are hosting the 2020 CCPS #ALLIN Back to School Drive-Thru, tomorrow, August 25 at the Stadium of Champions from noon to 6 PM.

This is the largest back to school event in the history of Christian County Public Schools and it is open to all students and their families! Families will receive much needed school supplies, personal care items, personal protection equipment such as hand sanitizers and masks, and a to-go lunch.

In order to maintain social distancing, participants will follow a marked route through the stadium parking lot. Please ENTER off of Eagle Way at the Hopkinsville Fire Department entrance of the stadium complex and you will be guided from there! Family Resource directors and community partners will be handing out food and supplies, as well as welcoming our students back!

Christian County Public Schools Family Resource and Youth Services Centers (FRYSCs) are hosting the 2020 CCPS #ALLIN Back to School Drive-Thru on Tuesday, August 25 at the Stadium of Champions from noon to 6 PM.
This is the largest back to school event in the history of CCPS and it is open to all students and their families! Families will receive much needed school supplies, personal care items, personal protection equipment such as hand sanitizers and masks, and a to-go lunch. In order to maintain social distancing, participants will follow a marked route through the stadium parking lot. FRYSC directors and community partners will be handing out food and supplies, as well as welcoming our students back!
FRYSCs offer a blend of programs and services determined by the needs of the population, and have an established record of success in supporting student achievement.
If your organization would like to be a part of this event, please contact Mary Saupe, at 270-887-7000.

Parents and guardians of incoming 6th grade students,

August 18th & 20th, from 4:30pm - 7:00pm, Music Central of Hopkinsville will be at the Christian County Middle School Performing Arts Center (PAC) will be testing instruments for students in 6th Grade Band. Attending these testing events does not mean you are committed to 6th Grade Band!

Instruments will be sanitized with an ethanol based wipe, sprayed with Sanitmist, and will spend 15 minutes in a UV light cabinet for complete disinfecting. If you do not feel comfortable with this process, we can select a student instrument by identifying physical features and using a chart to select an instrument that best suits the student without actually playing it. The event is for you to ask any questions you may have and to potentially choose an instrument.

Please direct any questions or concerns to Lori Boehman at (270) 305-2460 (text or call) or via email: lori.boehman@christian.kyschools.us

The Christian County Public Schools Board of Education has voted to follow the recommendation of Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear to begin the 2020-21 school year on August 27th with Non-Traditional Instruction (NTI) until September 28th. Under NTI, students will engage with their teachers virtually through a learning management system. Before the August 27th start date, parents and guardians will be contacted directly by their child’s school to communicate expectations and needs for online learning.

Beverly Fort has been appointed Teacher Recruiter for Christian County Public Schools. Fort returns to the district after serving as the Education Coordinator at Murray State University’s Hopkinsville campus. She previously taught at Morningside and Millbrooke Elementary Schools and was later Curriculum Specialist at Millbrooke.
In her new position, Fort will identify, recruit, and retain teachers in the district, while coordinating and assessing training opportunities for current teachers.
Fort is a native of Hopkinsville, Kentucky and holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Elementary Education and a Master’s Degree and Rank I in Administration from Murray State University.
She and her husband, Kerry, have three children. Riley is a sophomore at the University of Kentucky, Allie is entering 10th grade at Hopkinsville High School, and Cooper is entering 6th grade at Millbrooke Elementary School.

A native of Evansville, IN, his wife Lori teaches Music at South Christian Elementary School and their sons Elijah, Blake, and Kyle attend Christian County Public Schools.

CCPS recently hosted its first English Learner (EL) Parent Outreach program of the year. The program is designed to encourage parents and families to attend whose first language is something other than English. District staff and volunteers assist parents with English as a Second Language classes so that they can better participate in the education of their child, provides study sessions for the GED, homework help, and tutoring for school-aged students. The EL Parent Outreach meets each Monday at Gateway Academy's Breathitt Campus at 715 North Drive from 5:30pm to 7:00 pm and follows the CCPS District calendar.

District EL teachers (Vicky Barnes, Tanya Counts, Gayle Holder, Lindsay Christopher, and Tina Mullins) all were in attendance. Vicky Barnes and Tim Barnes lead this effort. If you know of a family who might benefit from participating, please let them know about this opportunity!

Since then we have been in contact with various federal, state, and local law enforcement agencies. This Facebook threat comes from a foreign country and is very generalized and unsubstantiated. Regardless, Christian County Public Schools will remain alert and vigilant. As always, if you or your student see something, say something. Thank you.
